scenarioDescription:
The HD 120084 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 120084 is a star with 2.39 times the mass of the Sun, and 9.12 times its radius. It is located 336.08 light years away from the solar system.

HD 120084 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 120084 system


HD 120084 b

HD 120084 b was discovered by the Okayama Astrophysical Observatory observatory, in 2013-08, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 4.30 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 120084 b is 1431.000 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 120084 b is 12.900 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 120084 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HD 120084, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the Okayama Astrophysical Observatory.
name: HD 120084 - System With 1 Exoplanet
